net.jxta.content
Interface ContentTransferListener

All Superinterfaces:
EventListener
All Known Implementing Classes:
TransferAggregator
public interface ContentTransferListener
extends EventListener

Listener interface used for monitoring the progress of a Content transfer.

The progress made method intentionally avoids the use of a transfer event object. This was done for performance reasons where many updates would have translated into many event objects being created and disposed of.

Method Summary
 void contentLocationStateUpdated(ContentTransferEvent event)
          Called when remote data source location has started, stopped, or possibly when the remote source count has been modified.
 void contentTransferProgress(ContentTransferEvent event)
          Called when transfer progress has been made.
 void contentTransferStateUpdated(ContentTransferEvent event)
          Called when Content data transfer status has changed.
 

Method Detail

contentLocationStateUpdated

void contentLocationStateUpdated(ContentTransferEvent event)
Called when remote data source location has started, stopped, or possibly when the remote source count has been modified.

Parameters:
event - content transfer event object

contentTransferStateUpdated

void contentTransferStateUpdated(ContentTransferEvent event)
Called when Content data transfer status has changed.

Parameters:
event - content transfer event object

contentTransferProgress

void contentTransferProgress(ContentTransferEvent event)
Called when transfer progress has been made. The extent to which a transfer implementation fires this event is left up to the implementation.

Parameters:
event - content transfer event object
